item.title: Uber Eats now lets merchants message customers about their orders
item.dc:creator: Aisha Malik
item.description: With the new Live order chat feature, merchants can message with customers in real-time to do things like confirm replacements for sold out items, clarify special requests, and check in on dietary or allergy preferences.

item.title: Proton releases a new app for two-factor authentication
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
item.description: Proton has a free new authenticator apps, which is available cross-platform with end-to-end encryption protection for data.

item.title: GitHub Copilot crosses 20 million all-time users
item.dc:creator: Maxwell Zeff
item.description: One of the most popular AI coding tools on the market added five million users in the last three months.

item.title: Kleiner Perkins-backed Ambiq pops on IPO debut
item.dc:creator: Marina Temkin
item.description: The 15-year-old chipmaker saw its shares climb 61% above its IPO price by the close of its first trading day.

item.title: Aurora’s autonomous trucks are now driving at night. Its next big challenge is rain.
item.dc:creator: Kirsten Korosec
item.description: The company has also opened another facility in Phoenix as it scales driverless operations.

item.title: Figma’s IPO price hit a $19.3B valuation out of the gate
item.dc:creator: Julie Bort
item.description: In what should be a surprise to no one, Figma priced its IPO shares above its already increased previously announced range.

item.title: Zuckerberg says people without AI glasses will be at a disadvantage in the future
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description: Mark Zuckerberg really believes AI glasses will be the ideal way to blend the physical and digital worlds together.

item.title: SpaceX faces two new lawsuits alleging safety‐related retaliation
item.dc:creator: Aria Alamalhodaei
item.description: The lawsuits offer a closer look at the safety environment at SpaceX.

item.title: Meta to spend up to $72B on AI infrastructure in 2025 as compute arms race escalates
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Bellan
item.description:
Meta is pouring money into the physical and technical infrastructure needed to scale its AI ambitions. The company said Wednesday in its second-quarter earnings report that it plans to more than double its spend on building AI infrastructure – like data centers and servers.
“We currently expect 2025 capital expenditures, including principal payments on finance leases, to be in the range of $66-72 billion…up approximately $30 billion year-over-year at the midpoint,” Meta said.

item.title: Zuckerberg: AI increased the time spent on Facebook and Instagram in Q2
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description: Overall, Meta estimated that over 3.4 billion people used one of its "family of apps" on a daily basis.

item.title: Google proposes to open Play Store to more real-money games in India
item.dc:creator: Jagmeet Singh
item.description: The developers are also required to submit proof that an authoritative third-party body has declared the app to be a "game of skill," the company proposed.

item.title: Big Tech to work with Trump administration to build digital health ecosystem
item.dc:creator: Dominic-Madori Davis
item.description: The efforts will focus on two areas: creating a framework for patients and providers to easily share information, and creating more personal tools so patients can access resources needed to stay informed about their health.

item.title: Palo Alto Networks agrees to buy CyberArk for $25 billion
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Szkutak
item.description: The cybersecurity giant is getting into identity security with its acquisition of CyberArk, which is one of the biggest cybersecurity deals of the year so far.

item.title: Germ brings end-to-end encrypted messages to Bluesky
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description: Germ's new app lets users send end-to-end encrypted messages on Bluesky. TechCrunch speaks with the Germ founders to hear why they came up with the idea.

item.title: Hackers stole Social Security numbers during Allianz Life cyberattack
item.dc:creator: Zack Whittaker
item.description: The U.S. insurance giant tells state regulators that Social Security numbers were among the personal information stolen in its mid-July cyberattack.

item.title: Zuckerberg signals Meta won’t open source all of its ‘superintelligence’ AI models
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Bellan
item.description: Meta is shifting how it plans to ensure widespread access to superintelligence, a suggestion that the company’s most advanced AI may remain closed so that Meta can stay in the driver’s seat.

item.title: Ramp hits $22.5B valuation just 45 days after reaching $16B
item.dc:creator: Julie Bort
item.description: In 2025, Ramp keeps raising money at increasing valuations as its CEO pursues an AI-powered future.

item.title: A guide to using Edits, Meta’s CapCut rival for short-form video editing
item.dc:creator: Aisha Malik
item.description: Meta shared that it was working on Edits in January after ByteDance-owned CapCut was removed from U.S. app stores.

item.title: How a New Jersey startup found an electrifying way to slash copper costs
item.dc:creator: Tim De Chant
item.description: Still Bright is now loaded up with $18.7 million in seed money to build out its demonstration unit.

item.title: PlayerZero raises $15M to prevent AI agents from shipping buggy code
item.dc:creator: Julie Bort
item.description: PlayerZero landed angel investors like Databricks' Matei Zaharia, Dropbox's Drew Houston, Figma's Dylan Field, and Vercel's Guillermo Rauch, its founder says.
